States have allocated 75% of federal funding received through the CARES Act, signed in March, according to a survey from the National Association of State Budget Officers. But based on their latest reports to Treasury, the average state has only spent just 18% of the money.

Offering an online option for veterans to view their C-File will cut bureaucracy and streamline the benefit claims process for veterans. I'm proud to work with Rep. Cox on this important legislation.

Currently, for a veteran to obtain their C-File, they must either travel to their regional office, submit a form via mail or fax, or submit a Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request. In the age of the 21st century, veterans should be able to access their files online.

Last week, @RepTjCox and I introduced H.R.7926, the Ensuring Veterans Access Act, to improve transparency for veterans attempting to access their claims file (C-File).

Our bipartisan bill will make it easier for veterans to obtain their info.
